thing-type.label: FGS223 Double Switch 2
thing-type.description: Double Switch 2<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtFIBARO Switch 2 is designed to be installed in standard wall switch boxes or anywhere else where it is necessary to control electric devices. FIBARO Switch 2 allows to control connected devices either via the Z-Wave+ network or via a switch connected directly to it and is equipped with active power and energy consumption metering functionality.</p&gt <p&gtMain features of FIBARO Switch 2:</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtCompatible with any Z-Wave or Z-Wave+ Controller,</li&gt <li&gtSupports protected mode (Z-Wave network security mode) with</li&gt <li&gtAES-128 encryption,</li&gt <li&gtAdvanced microprocessor control,</li&gt <li&gtActive power and energy metering functionality,</li&gt <li&gtWorks with various types of switches – momentary, toggle, three-way, etc,</li&gt <li&gtTo be installed in wall switch boxes of dimensions allowing for installation, conforming to provisions of applicable regulations,</li&gt <li&gtFIBARO Switch 2 is an extension unit.</li&gt </ul&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtPut controller into inclusion mode and triple click S1 switch</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtPut controller into exclusion mode and triple click S1 switch</p&gt

parameter.name: config_9_1
parameter.label: 9: Restore state after power failure
parameter.description: Restore state after power failure<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines if the device will return to state prior to the power failure after power is restored.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_10_1
parameter.label: 10: First channel operating mode
parameter.description: First channel - operating mode<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter allows to choose operating for the 1st channel controlled by the S1 switch.</p&gt <p&gtNOTE<br /&gtWhen parameter 10 value is set to 5, then parameter 11 value must be set to 0.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_11_1
parameter.label: 11: 1st ch. reaction to switch
parameter.description: First channel - reaction to switch for delay/auto ON/OFF modes<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines how the device in timed mode reacts to pushing the switch connected to the S1 terminal.</p&gt <p&gtNOTE<br /&gtWhen parameter 10 value is set to 5, then parameter 11 value must be set to 0.</p&gt</p&gt

options.option: cancel mode and set target state
no reaction to switch - mode runs until it ends
reset timer - start counting from the beginning

parameter.name: config_12_2
parameter.label: 12: time parameter for delay/auto ON/OFF modes
parameter.description: First channel - time parameter for delay/auto ON/OFF modes<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter allows to set time parameter used in timed modes.</p&gt <p&gtAvailable settings: 0 (0.1s), 1-32000 (1-32000s, 1s step) - time parameter</p&gt <p&gtDefault setting: 50 (50s)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_13_2
parameter.label: 13: 1st ch. pulse time for flashing mode
parameter.description: First channel - pulse time for flashing mode<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter allows to set time of switching to opposite state in flashing mode</p&gt <p&gtAvailable settings: 1-32000 (0.1-3200.0s, 0.1s step) - time parameter</p&gt <p&gtDefault setting: 5 (0.5s)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_15_1
parameter.label: 15: 2nd ch. operating mode
parameter.description: Second channel - operating mode<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter allows to choose operating for the 1st channel controlled by the S2 switch.</p&gt <p&gtNOTE<br /&gtWhen parameter 15 value is set to 5, then parameter 16 value must be set to 0.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_16_1
parameter.label: 16: 2nd ch. reaction to switch
parameter.description: Second channel - reaction to switch for delay/auto ON/OFF modes<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines how the device in timed mode reacts to pushing the switch connected to the S2 terminal.</p&gt <p&gtNOTE<br /&gtWhen parameter 15 value is set to 5, then parameter 16 value must be set to 0.</p&gt</p&gt

options.option: cancel mode and set target state
no reaction to switch - mode runs until it ends
reset timer - start counting from the beginning

parameter.name: config_17_2
parameter.label: 17: 2nd ch. time parameter for delay
parameter.description: Second channel - time parameter for delay/auto ON/OFF modes<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter allows to set time parameter used in timed modes.</p&gt <p&gtAvailable settings: 0 (0.1s), 1-32000 (1-32000s, 1s step) - time parameter</p&gt <p&gtDefault setting: 50 (50s)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_18_2
parameter.label: 18: 2nd ch. pulse time for flashing mode
parameter.description: Second channel - pulse time for flashing mode<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter allows to set time of switching to opposite state in flashing mode</p&gt <p&gtAvailable settings: 1-32000 (0.1-3200.0s, 0.1s step) - time parameter</p&gt <p&gtDefault setting: 5 (0.5s)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_20_1
parameter.label: 20: Switch type
parameter.description: Switch type<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter defines as what type the device should treat the switch connected to the S1 and S2 terminals</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_21_1
parameter.label: 21: Flashing mode - reports
parameter.description: Flashing mode - reports

options.option: the device does not send reports

parameter.name: config_27_1
parameter.label: 27: Associations in Z-Wave network security mode
parameter.description: Associations in Z-Wave network security mode<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter defines how commands are sent in specified association groups: as secure or non-secure. Parameter is active only in Z-Wave network security mode. This parameter does not apply to 1st „Lifeline” group.</p&gt <p&gtAvailable settings:</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gt1 - 2nd group sent as secure</li&gt <li&gt2 - 3rd group sent as secure</li&gt <li&gt4 - 4th group sent as secure</li&gt <li&gt8 - 5th group sent as secure</li&gt </ul&gt<p&gtParameter 27 values may be combined, e.g. 1+2=3 means that 2nd &amp; 3rd groups are sent as secure.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_28_1
parameter.label: 28: S1 switch - scenes sent
parameter.description: S1 switch - scenes sent<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines which actions result in sending scene IDs assigned to them.</p&gt <p&gtAvailable settings:</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gt1 - Key pressed 1 time</li&gt <li&gt2 - Key pressed 2 times</li&gt <li&gt4 - Key pressed 3 times</li&gt <li&gt8 - Key Hold Down and Key Released</li&gt </ul&gt<p&gtParameter 28 values may be combined, e.g. 1+2=3 means that scenes for single and double click are sent.</p&gt</p&gt

options.option: Key Hold Down and Key Released
In all cases a scene ID will be sent

parameter.name: config_29_1
parameter.label: 29: S2 switch - scenes sent
parameter.description: S2 switch - scenes sent<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines which actions result in sending scene IDs assigned to them.</p&gt <p&gtAvailable settings:</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gt1 - Key pressed 1 time</li&gt <li&gt2 - Key pressed 2 times</li&gt <li&gt4 - Key pressed 3 times</li&gt <li&gt8 - Key Hold Down and Key Released</li&gt </ul&gt<p&gtParameter 29 values may be combined, e.g. 1+2=3 means that scenes for single and double click are sent.</p&gt</p&gt

options.option: Key Hold Down and Key Released
In all cases a scene ID will be sent

parameter.name: config_30_1
parameter.label: 30: S1 assocs. sent to 2nd and 3rd group
parameter.description: S1 switch - associations sent to 2nd and 3rd association groups<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines which actions are ignored when sending commands to devices associated in 2nd and 3rd association group. All actions are active by default.</p&gt <p&gtAvailable settings:</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gt1 - ignore turning On with 1 click of the switch</li&gt <li&gt2 - ignore turning OFF with 1 click of the switch</li&gt <li&gt4 - ignore holding and releasing the switch*</li&gt <li&gt8 - ignore double click of the switch**</li&gt </ul&gt<p&gtParameter 30 values may be combined, e.g. 1+2=3 means that associations for turning On and OFF are not sent.</p&gt <p&gtNOTE:<br /&gt*Hold and release is inactive when parameter 20 is set to 1 or 2.<br /&gt**Double click is inactive when parameter 20 is set to 1.</p&gt</p&gt

options.option: All actions are active by default
ignore turning ON with 1 click of the switch
ignore turning OFF with 1 click of the switch
ignore holding and releasing the switch
ignore double click of the switch

parameter.name: config_31_2
parameter.label: 31: S1 ON val sent to 2nd and 3rd groups
parameter.description: S1 switch - Switch ON value sent to 2nd and 3rd association groups<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtNOTE:</p&gt <p&gtSetting parameters 31-33, 36-38 to appropriate value should result in:</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gt0 </strong&gt- turning off associated devices</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gt1-99</strong&gt - forcing level of associated devices</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gt255</strong&gt - setting associated devices to the last remembered state or turning them on</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_32_2
parameter.label: 32: S1 OFF val sent to 2nd and 3rd groups
parameter.description: S1 switch - Switch ON value sent to 2nd and 3rd association groups<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter defines value sent with Switch OFF command to devices associated in 2nd and 3rd association group.</p&gt <p&gtNOTE:</p&gt <p&gtSetting parameters 31-33, 36-38 to appropriate value should result in:</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gt0</strong&gt - turning off associated devices</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gt1-99 </strong&gt - forcing level of associated devices</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gt255</strong&gt - setting associated devices to the last remembered state or turning them on</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_33_2
parameter.label: 33: S1 DblClick val sent to 2nd and 3rd groups
parameter.description: S1 switch - Double Click value sent to 2nd and 3rd association groups<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter defines value sent with Double Click command to devices associated in 2nd and 3rd association group.</p&gt <p&gtNOTE:</p&gt <p&gtSetting parameters 31-33, 36-38 to appropriate value should result in:</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gt0</strong&gt - turning off associated devices</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gt1-99 </strong&gt - forcing level of associated devices</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gt255</strong&gt - setting associated devices to the last remembered state or turning them on</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_35_1
parameter.label: 35: S2 assocs. sent to 4th and 5th group
parameter.description: S2 switch - associations sent to 4th and 5th association groups<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines which actions result in sending commands to devices associated in 4th and 5th association group. All actions are active by default.</p&gt <p&gtAvailable settings:</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gt1 - ignore turning On with 1 click of the switch</li&gt <li&gt2 - ignore turning OFF with 1 click of the switch</li&gt <li&gt4 - ignore holding and releasing the switch*</li&gt <li&gt8 - ignore double click of the switch**</li&gt </ul&gt<p&gtParameter 35 values may be combined, e.g. 1+2=3 means that associations for turning On and OFF are not sent.</p&gt <p&gtNOTE:</p&gt <p&gt*Hold and release is inactive when param-eter 20 is set to 1 or 2.</p&gt <p&gt**Double click is inac-tive when parameter 20 is set to 1.</p&gt</p&gt

options.option: All actions are active by default
ignore turning on with 1 click of the switch
ignore turning off with 1 click of the switch
ignore holding and releasing the switch
ignore double click of the switch

parameter.name: config_36_2
parameter.label: 36: S2 ON val sent to 4th and 5th groups
parameter.description: S2 switch - Switch ON value sent to 4th and 5th association groups<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter defines value sent with Switch On command to devic-es associated in 4th and 5th association group.</p&gt <p&gtNOTE:</p&gt <p&gtSetting parameters 31-33, 36-38 to appropriate value should result in:</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gt0</strong&gt - turning off associated devices</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gt1-99 </strong&gt - forcing level of associated devices</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gt255</strong&gt - setting associated devices to the last remembered state or turning them on</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_37_2
parameter.label: 37: S2 OFF val sent to 4th and 5th groups
parameter.description: S2 switch - Switch OFF value sent to 4th and 5th association groups<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter defines value sent with Switch OFF command to de-vices associated in 4th and 5th association group.</p&gt <p&gtNOTE:</p&gt <p&gtSetting parameters 31-33, 36-38 to appropriate value should result in:</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gt0</strong&gt - turning off associated devices</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gt1-99 </strong&gt - forcing level of associated devices</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gt255</strong&gt - setting associated devices to the last remembered state or turning them on</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_38_2
parameter.label: 38: S2 DblClick val sent to 4th and 5th groups
parameter.description: S2 switch - Double Click value sent to 4th and 5th association groups<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter defines value sent with Double Click command to de-vices associated in 4th and 5th association group.</p&gt <p&gtNOTE:</p&gt <p&gtSetting parameters 31-33, 36-38 to appropriate value should result in:</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gt0</strong&gt - turning off associated devices</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gt1-99 </strong&gt - forcing level of associated devices</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gt255</strong&gt - setting associated devices to the last remembered state or turning them on</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_40_1
parameter.label: 40: Reaction to General Alarm
parameter.description: Reaction to General Alarm<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines how the device will react to General Alarm frame.</p&gt</p&gt

options.option: turn ON after receiving the alarm frame
turn OFF after receiving the alarm frame
flash after receiving the alarm frame

parameter.name: config_41_1
parameter.label: 41: Reaction to Flood Alarm
parameter.description: Reaction to Flood Alarm

options.option: turn ON after receiving the alarm frame
turn OFF after receiving the alarm frame
flash after receiving the alarm frame

parameter.name: config_42_1
parameter.label: 42: Reaction to CO/CO2/Smoke Alarm
parameter.description: Reaction to CO/CO2/Smoke Alarm

options.option: turn ON after receiving the alarm frame
turn OFF after receiving the alarm frame
flash after receiving the alarm frame

parameter.name: config_43_1
parameter.label: 43: Reaction to Heat Alarm
parameter.description: Reaction to Heat Alarm

options.option: turn ON after receiving the alarm frame
turn OFF after receiving the alarm frame
flash after receiving the alarm frame

parameter.name: config_44_2
parameter.label: 44: Flashing alarm duration
parameter.description: Flashing alarm duration<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter allows to set duration of flashing alarm mode.</p&gt <p&gtAvailable settings: 1-32000 (1-32000s, 1s step) - duration</p&gt <p&gtDefault setting: 600 (10min)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_50_1
parameter.label: 50: First channel - power reports
parameter.description: First channel - power reports<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines the minimum change in consumed power that will result in sending new power report to the main controller.</p&gt <p&gtAvailable settings:</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gt0 - reports are disabled</li&gt <li&gt1-100 (1-100%) - change in power</li&gt </ul&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_51_1
parameter.label: 51: 1st ch min time between reports
parameter.description: First channel - minimal time between power reports<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines minimum time that has to elapse before sending new power report to the main controller.</p&gt <p&gtAvailable settings: </p&gt <p&gt0 - reports are disabled</p&gt <p&gt1-120 (1-120s) - report interval</p&gt <p&gtDefault setting: 10 (10s)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_53_2
parameter.label: 53: 1st ch energy reports
parameter.description: First channel - energy reports<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines minimum time that has to elapse before</p&gt <p&gtsending new power report to the main controller.</p&gt <p&gtAvailable settings:</p&gt <p&gt0 - reports are disabled</p&gt <p&gt1-32000 (0.01 - 320 kWh) - change in energy</p&gt <p&gtDefault: 100 (1 KWh)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_54_1
parameter.label: 54: Second channel - power reports
parameter.description: Second channel - power reports<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines the minimum change in consumed power that will result in sending new power report to the main controller.</p&gt <p&gtAvailable settings:</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gt0 - reports are disabled</li&gt <li&gt1-100 (1-100%) - change in power</li&gt </ul&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_55_1
parameter.label: 55: 2nd ch min time between reports
parameter.description: Second channel - minimal time between power reports<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines minimum time that has to elapse before sending new power report to the main controller.</p&gt <p&gtAvailable settings:</p&gt <p&gt0 - periodic reports are disabled</p&gt <p&gt1-120 (1-120s) - report interval</p&gt <p&gtDefault setting: 10 (10s)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_57_2
parameter.label: 57: 2nd ch energy reports
parameter.description: Second channel - energy reports<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines the minimum change in consumed energy that will result in sending new energy report to the main controller.</p&gt <p&gtAvailable settings:</p&gt <p&gt0 - reports are disabled</p&gt <p&gt1-32000 (0.01 - 320 kWh) - change in energy</p&gt <p&gtDefault setting: 100 (1 KWh)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_58_2
parameter.label: 58: Periodic power reports
parameter.description: Periodic power reports<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines in what time interval the periodic power reports are sent to the main controller.</p&gt <p&gtAvailable settings: </p&gt <p&gt0 - periodic reports are disabled</p&gt <p&gt1-32000 (1-32000s) - report interval</p&gt <p&gtDefault setting: 3600 (1h)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_59_2
parameter.label: 59: Periodic energy reports
parameter.description: Periodic energy reports<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines in what time interval the periodic energy reports are sent to the main controller.</p&gt <p&gtAvailable settings:</p&gt <p&gt0 - periodic reports are disabled</p&gt <p&gt1-32000 (1-32000s) - report interval</p&gt <p&gtDefault setting: 3600 (1h)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_60_1
parameter.label: 60: Include own energy
parameter.description: Measuring energy consumed by the device itself<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines whether energy metering should include the amount of energy consumed by the device itself. Results are being added to energy reports for first endpoint.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: group_1
parameter.label: 1: Lifeline
parameter.description: Reports the device status and allows for assigning single device only (main controller by default).<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt1st association group – “Lifeline” reports the device status and allows for assigning single device only (main controller by default).</p&gt

parameter.name: group_2
parameter.label: 2: On/Off (S1)
parameter.description: On/Off (S1) is assigned to switch connected to the S1 terminal (uses Basic command class)<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt2nd association group – “On/Off (S1)” is assigned to switch connected to the S1 terminal (uses Basic command class).</p&gt

parameter.name: group_3
parameter.label: 3: Dimmer (S1)
parameter.description: “Dimmer (S1)” is assigned to switch connected to the S1 terminal (uses Switch Multilevel command class)<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt“Dimmer (S1)” is assigned to switch connected to the S1 terminal (uses Switch Multilevel command class)</p&gt

parameter.name: group_4
parameter.label: 4: On/Off (S2)
parameter.description: On/Off (S2) is assigned to switch connected to the S2 terminal (uses Basic command class)<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtOn/Off (S2) is assigned to switch connected to the S2 terminal (uses Basic command class)</p&gt

parameter.name: group_5
parameter.label: 5: Dimmer (S2)
parameter.description: Dimmer (S2) is assigned to switch connected to the S2 terminal (uses Switch Multilevel command class)<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtDimmer (S2) is assigned to switch connected to the S2 terminal (uses Switch Multilevel command class)</p&gt
